update.description:
This version of the library should allow to publish/subscribe messages between nodes. The messages are typed and if the nodes are within the same process, no serialization should be done.

Requires: zeromq, czmq, robot_msgs, protobuf, and uuid-dev. It also requires c++11 (as probably most of the ignition projects).
update.title: Initial version
update.reason:
Replaced by pull request #3

(All the comments of this pull request have been included in pull request #3).

content.raw: I'd like to remove the "Node" concept. Creating a "Node" object is not necessary, and would simplify the code.
content.html: I'd like to remove the "Node" concept. Creating a "Node" object is not necessary, and would simplify the code.

update.description:
This version of the library should allow to publish/subscribe messages between nodes. The messages are typed and if the nodes are within the same process, no serialization should be done.

Requires: zeromq, czmq, robot_msgs, protobuf, and uuid-dev. It also requires c++11 (as probably most of the ignition projects).
update.title: Initial version

content.raw: Updated: The subscription handlers now use a UUID as a key to identify its node. Previously, they were using a thread_id, which was a bad idea because several nodes within the same thread were sharing the same id (see 804493b).
content.html: Updated: The subscription handlers now use a UUID as a key to identify its node. Previously, they were using a thread_id, which was a bad idea because several nodes within the same thread were sharing the same id (see 804493b).
Added in e4b35a9 and 52a7781.

content.raw: Consider using a global const or a macro for this number
content.html: Consider using a global const or a macro for this number

Consider making this function void, since it can only return a single value.

if(node.Advertise('supertopic') {
    // this is impossible
}

content.html: /// \brief Message header with the topic, message type and optional flags information

content.raw: Is it a good idea to libzmq3-dev here, too?
content.html: Is it a good idea to libzmq3-dev here, too?

content.raw:
I think it would be nice to mention the minimum required g++ version (4.8) and the dependencies:
    - 0mq
    - robot_msgs
    - czmq (built from source)
    - ronn
content.html: I think it would be nice to mention the minimum required g++ version (4.8) and the dependencies: - 0mq - robot_msgs - czmq (built from source) - ronn
